newsitem.title: USA: Biogen sells Hirulog drug - report.
newsitem.headline: Biogen sells Hirulog drug - report.

text.p: Biogen licensed all rights to the anticlotting drug Hirulog to The Medicines Co for $30 million, far less than the $150 million spent to develop the drug, the Boston Globe reported Wednesday.

Under the terms of the agreement, The Medicines Co (TMC), a privately held biopharmaceutical company headquartered in Cambridge, Mass., will receive exclusive worldwide rights to develop and sell Hirulog.
The agreement includes $30 million of upfront fees, milestone payments and development commitments, as well as royalty payments on Hirulog sales, the Globe said.
Biogen discontinued Hirulog development in October, 1994.
TMC plans to file for regulatory approval of Hirulog in the U.S. and Europe.
